meanings.definition: To accelerate or move quickly, especially with a loud noise.
meanings.sent1: The car varoomed down the street, making everyone turn their heads.
meanings.sent2: The motorcycle varoomed past us on the highway.
meanings.sent3: The rocket varoomed into space, leaving a trail of smoke behind.
meanings.sent4: The cheetah varoomed across the savannah, chasing its prey.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds varoomed in, bringing heavy rain and thunder.

meanings.definition: Past tense of varoom: to have accelerated or moved quickly, especially with a loud noise.
meanings.sent1: The car varoomed away before we could catch a glimpse of the driver.
meanings.sent2: The plane varoomed off the runway and into the sky.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel varoomed up the tree, surprising the birds perched on the branches.
meanings.sent4: The idea varoomed into his mind, sparking a new wave of creativity.
meanings.sent5: The news of the victory varoomed through the town, spreading joy to all.
